snippet: A bill in the General Assembly would prohibit motorists from driving with dogs in their laps. A first offense would draw a fine of $85, and a second $100.
abstract: State Representative Peter G Palumbo of Rhode Island proposes bill in the General Assembly that would prohibit motorists from driving with dogs in their laps.
lead_paragraph: A bill in the General Assembly would prohibit motorists from driving with dogs in their laps. A first offense would draw a fine of $85, and a second $100.

headline.main: Rhode Island: Bill Would Ban Dogs on Drivers’ Laps
headline.print_headline: Rhode Island: Bill Would Ban Dogs On Drivers’ Laps
